author: Venunder
title: Magazine Micro X-wing
review:
I should not have expected too much from a Magazine toy.

Box/Instructions

The image on the bag makes the most of this micro fighter.

Parts

23 small parts.

Minifigures

None.

The build

With only 23 parts the build takes less than a minute, but has some clever part usage.

The Light Saber Handles work well as the four laser canons.

The completed model

Although this is a micro fighter it is still not quite in scale with either the Death Star One or Two. Quite possibly this is about the right scale to go with a Star Destroyer? 

Overall opinion

Only really worth while for Die Hard Star Wars fans.

author: Witolman
title: Great magazine gift
review:
(My English is not  perfect but I'm trying to not make any mistakes.)

Box/Instructions

There are no normal instructions, but honestly, who needs one for such a small set. There is something like instructions in the magazine, though. The foil pack this comes in is interesting, because you don't have to rip it to get to parts. On back of it there's a part that's closed with just glue, so you can open AND close it.

Parts

23 simple parts.

The build

Less than a minute.

The completed model

.....It's a X-wing! It looks really simple, but it's okay. It's wings can move up and down a little. It has a blue stud in the middle to represent an astromech.

Overall opinion

It's a great gift, but only if you are also interested in the magazine itself. There's a poster of Yoda and Kanan Jarrus in it, if anyone is interested. It's not worth buying a magazine just for this model, though.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Inaccurate but nice build
review:
Opening;

This rebel alliance T-65 X-wing is a very meaningful set to me as it was something I played with for days when I got it back in summer 2015 . 

The build-

The build revolves around a red 1×2 double sided snot brick , with clips , then modified plates , then lightsaber hilts for the main barrels , the cockpit is an indented snot brick with a dark Trans cheese slope for the window , the nose is some bricks stacked and and cheese slope to top it off .

In conclusion-

this is a very playable set and looks decent on display not a set for everyone but I still think it is fairly decent .
